p: C. tetragonoloba was selected on the basis of traditional knowledge and collected from agriculture fields of village Majra (Dubaldhan), district Jhajjar, Haryana, India. The geographical location of the collection site is Latitude 28° 41′ 15.432″ N and Longitude 76° 52′ 47.028″ E. Plant samples were transported to the laboratory in sterile bags. After proper identification by a taxonomist, the plant material was washed with tap water to remove the dust and rinse with distilled water. The material was stored in a shade and dry place at room temperature and minced after dry.
